wordcram

Class Anglers

  • java.lang.Object
    • wordcram.Anglers

  • public class Anglers
extends java.lang.Object
    Some pre-fab WordAnglers.

    If you want a pretty typical WordAngler, it's probably in here; if you want to know how to build your own WordAngler, you can learn from the source for these.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Anglers() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static WordAngler alwaysUse(float angle)
      If you want all your words to be drawn at the same angle, use this.
      static WordAngler heaped() 
      static WordAngler hexes()
      A WordAngler that draws all words at hexagonal angles, or (if you're a bit more mathy) 0π/6, 1π/6, 2π/6, 3π/6, 4π/6, and 5π/6.
      static WordAngler horiz()
      A WordAngler that draws all words horizontally.
      static WordAngler mostlyHoriz()
      A WordAngler that draws 5/7 words horizontally, and the rest going up and down.

      Just like alwaysUse(float), but it takes multiple angles.
      static WordAngler random() 
      static WordAngler randomBetween(float min, float max) 
      static WordAngler upAndDown()
      A WordAngler that draws all words vertically, pointing both up and down.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Anglers

        public Anglers()

    • Method Detail

      • random

        public static WordAngler random()
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that gives a random angle every time it's called.

      • randomBetween

        public static WordAngler randomBetween(float min,
                       float max)
        Parameters:
        min - the lower-bound of the angle range
        max - the upper-bound of the angle range
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that gives a random angle between min and max, every time it's called.

      • heaped

        public static WordAngler heaped()
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that angles all words between -7 degrees and 7 degrees, for a "heaped" effect.

      • alwaysUse

        public static WordAngler alwaysUse(float angle)
        If you want all your words to be drawn at the same angle, use this. For example, horiz() is basically implemented as return alwaysUse(0f);.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle all words should be rotated at.
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that always returns the given angle parameter.
        See Also:
        horiz()

      • pickFrom

        public static WordAngler pickFrom(float... angles)
        Just like alwaysUse(float), but it takes multiple angles. If you want all your words to be drawn at the same N angles, pass those angles to alwaysUse(float). You can pass as many angles as you like.

        For example, if you want all your words drawn on 45° and 135° angles, use Anglers.pickFrom(radians(45), radians(135)). hexes() is a similar example.

        Parameters:
        angles - The angles all words should be rotated at.
        Returns:
        A WordAngler that will pick one of the angles, at random, for each word.
        See Also:
        alwaysUse(float), hexes()

      • hexes

        public static WordAngler hexes()
        A WordAngler that draws all words at hexagonal angles, or (if you're a bit more mathy) 0π/6, 1π/6, 2π/6, 3π/6, 4π/6, and 5π/6. It gives a vaguely snow-flake look.

        It's implemented with pickFrom(float...).

        (In retrospect, this is probably not one you'll use very often, so it might not merit a place in Anglers. But whatever.)

        Returns:
        a WordAngler that draws all words at hexagonal angles.
        See Also:
        pickFrom(float...)

      • horiz

        public static WordAngler horiz()
        A WordAngler that draws all words horizontally. It uses alwaysUse(float).
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that draws all words horizontally.

      • upAndDown

        public static WordAngler upAndDown()
        A WordAngler that draws all words vertically, pointing both up and down. It uses pickFrom(float...).
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that draws all words vertically, pointing both up and down.

      • mostlyHoriz

        public static WordAngler mostlyHoriz()
        A WordAngler that draws 5/7 words horizontally, and the rest going up and down. It makes for a pretty nice effect. A WordAngler that draws all words vertically, pointing both up and down. It uses pickFrom(float...).
        Returns:
        a WordAngler that draws most of the words horizontally, and the rest vertically.
